metadata.title: CVE-2020-6812 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The first time AirPods are connected to an iPhone, they become named afterthe user's name by default (e.g. Jane Doe's AirPods.) Websites with cameraor microphone permission are able to enumerate device names, disclosing theuser's name. To resolve this issue, Firefox added a special case thatrenames devices containing the substring 'AirPods' to simply 'AirPods'.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox <ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
